James Clapper: s statement in a Meet The Press interview on March 5, where he said there was no evidence of collusion between the Trump campaign and Russian officials.
The release of a report by Clapper: s office two months earlier, which stated with "high confidence" that the Russian government interfered in the 2016 election but did not include evidence of collusion.
Clapper: s confirmation during a Senate Judiciary subcommittee hearing on May 8 that his previous statement on Meet The Press was still accurate.
Some officials with knowledge of the FBI: s Russia probe declining to say there is no evidence of collusion, citing ongoing investigations.
